meanings.definition: A stipend or portion of the revenues of a cathedral or collegiate church, assigned to a canon or member of the chapter.
meanings.sent1: The prebends provided financial support to the church members.
meanings.sent2: Receiving prebends was a common practice in medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The prebends decided to have a picnic with their stipends.
meanings.sent4: The prebends flowed into the church's coffers like a steady stream.
meanings.sent5: The prebends gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of dedication and service.

meanings.sent1: The bishop prebends the new canon to his post.
meanings.sent2: She prebends the church duties among the clergy members.
meanings.sent3: The mayor prebends the tasks to different departments for efficiency.
meanings.sent4: He prebends responsibilities like a skilled organizer.
meanings.sent5: Prebending the roles ensures a fair distribution of work.
